ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This is unrealistically set to one semester. I had lofty goals, and if I wanted to accomplish those goals I would have had to spend 20 hours a week on this one class.
Strengths: -Personalized experience Improvements: -May be more effective to have preceptors within the school campus to ensure productivity and improve student experience

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shelley Geballe  I would have preferred some more direct feedback on my project from a law/policy perspective

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Professor Geballe is great!!! She really makes an effort to get to know each student and their experience with the practicum. She is personally invested in every single project and does her best to make every student's experience fruitful and memorable.

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley was very helpful in the practicum placements, and was very sensitive to students' needs. She did her best in ensuring students had a productive and meaningful experience.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Don't do this in the fall, for one reason or another its hard to get done. Also consider spreading this course out over two semesters

I would recommend this course if the student already has a placement in mind. This is not a hands-off course and you really need to set aside 8 to 10 hours a week. But it's an excellent course to get some hands-on experience.
Yes, I would recommend this course for another student; however, a great experience depends on both the student and the preceptor.
